projects.title: Flixr
projects.excerpt: A movie database built in React.js using themoviedb.org API that enables users to explore, search, and bookmark movies.

post.overview1: A movie database built in React.js, utilizing the themoviedb.org API. It incorporates a feature that allows users to add movies to their favorites, with persistent storage ensured through local storage.
post.overview2: In addition, a mockup was created using Photoshop and a prototype was developed using Adobe XD to visualize the design and functionality of the application.

accordions.title: Project Requirements
accordions.content: The project involved building an app connected to the themoviedb.org API. The main requirement was to create a homepage that displays a grid of movies, sortable by popularity, top ratings, current releases, and upcoming releases
accordions.content1: Each movie card on the grid should link to a detailed movie page, showcasing additional information like a summary and a backdrop image. Additionally, a favorites page was implemented to show the user's selected movies.
accordions.content2: The ability to add or remove favorites was implemented on the homepage, movie pages, and the favorites page using local storage.

accordions.title: UX / UI Design
accordions.intro: NOTE: The following steps do not reflect the design of 'Flixr'. This was a school project where each of us worked individually on our own design. For the development phase, we selected one design from the group. However, I still wanted to share the process I went through and the skills I acquired.
accordions.content: The design of the application underwent several stages. Firstly, I created a logo using Adobe Illustrator, followed by creating a mockup using Photoshop, and finally developing a prototype using Adobe XD.

tabs.subtitle: Adobe Suite
tabs.heading: Illustrator
tabs.content: In the design section of the movie database, I took inspiration from the design of Netflix. The application's visual elements, such as the logo, were created using Adobe Illustrator, and the chosen color scheme was based on Netflix's colors.
tabs.content1: I utilized Photoshop's tools and features to create a professional and visually appealing mockup.
tabs.content2: I then created a prototype with Adobe XD. To view the prototype, click the links below.

tabs.subtitle: Final Design
tabs.content: During the development phase in React, our team of 3 collectively agreed to adopt the design crafted by my classmate.
tabs.content1: This decision led to the incorporation of design elements from both our original mockup and our classmate's design contributions in the final design of the movie database.
tabs.content2: To view the design, please click on the following link:

accordions.title: Development Highlights
accordions.intro: During my work on the Movie Database, I gained valuable experience in team collaboration using GitHub.
accordions.content: I explored various React features that greatly influenced my experience and growth. Let's focus on two standout topics in this summary.

tabs.subtitle: Search Feature
tabs.heading: UseLocation Hook
tabs.content: The useLocation hook returns an object that represents the current URL and provides various properties and methods to access different parts of the URL. In our app, useLocation is used to get the current location object
tabs.content1: By using the location.search property, which represents the query string portion of the URL, the code extracts the value of the 'query' parameter from the URL. This allows the code to retrieve the search query entered by the user, which can be used to fetch relevant movies or display an error message if no movies are found.
tabs.content2: The URLSearchParams is a built-in JavaScript API that provides methods to work with the query string of a URL. It allows you to parse and manipulate the parameters in the URL's query string.
tabs.content3: 'new URLSearchParams'(location.search) creates a new URLSearchParams object using the location.search property, which represents the query string part of the current URL. Then, .get('query') is called on that object to retrieve the value of the 'query' parameter from the URL. This extracts the search query entered by the user.

tabs.subtitle: REST API Fetching
tabs.content: We practiced and implemented both async/await and fetch methods for data fetching.
tabs.heading: Async/Await
tabs.content2: With async/await, we were able to write asynchronous code that looks and feels more like traditional synchronous code, making it easier to handle tasks that require time.
tabs.content1: We also explored the fetch method, which allows us to send requests to retrieve data from external sources. By utilizing then and catch methods, we were able to handle the response and potential errors effectively.

accordions.title: Retrospective
accordions.question: What did I learn?
accordions.content: Throughout this project, I acquired valuable skills in logo creation, mockup design, prototype development, and React.js. Encountering bugs reinforced the importance of thorough testing and debugging for a seamless user experience. This experience highlighted the significance of meticulous bug fixing and code refactoring to enhance the overall code quality.
accordions.content2: We recognized the importance of meticulous testing to ensure a robust and reliable application. Additionally, we identified bugs in the favorite functionality post-deployment, which require refactoring to ensure smooth operation.
accordions.content1: Furthermore, there is an opportunity to enhance the design by incorporating additional movie details such as casting information and YouTube video links for trailers.

projects.title: www.martha.codes
projects.excerpt: My portfolio is a multilingual site that showcases a React project where I utilize the i18n library to seamlessly switch between languages. Additionally, it offers a dark/light theme option and project sorting functionality.

post.overview1: My portfolio project aims to showcase my skills as a front-end developer and UX designer through a curated selection of my best works, reflecting my attention to detail and user-centered design approach.

accordions.title: Project Requirements
accordions.content: Create a professional and consistent portfolio that showcases selected projects, reflects my personal branding, and provides easy contact options for potential employers.
accordions.content1: Develop a captivating user experience that effectively communicates my skills, expertise, and passion for front-end development and UX design.
accordions.content2: Demonstrate a range of projects, including both selected works and practice projects, to showcase problem-solving abilities, user-centered design approach, and the impact of my work.Additionally, incorporate aspects of my personal interests and hobbies to provide a well-rounded view of who I am as a professional.

tabs.subtitle: Adobe XD
tabs.content1: I developed a site map to organize and visualize the structure of my portfolio. It allowed me to plan pages, sections, and navigation paths effectively, providing a clear overview of the website's architecture. The site map was a valuable reference, ensuring a well-organized and user-friendly website.
tabs.heading: Prototype
tabs.content: Afterwards, I developed a prototype of the website to practice prototyping and explore different visual styles. Taking inspiration from Brittany Chiang's design, I incorporated elements that resonated with my vision. Additionally, I added extra functionality, including a dark/light theme, to enhance the user experience.

tabs.subtitle: Final Design
tabs.heading: Improved Navigation
tabs.content: After receiving valuable feedback from a teacher, I reworked the navigation on my website. I replaced the hamburger menu with a more user-friendly approach, ensuring the navigation is easily accessible at the bottom on mobile and on the right side on desktop. This enhancement significantly improved the overall user experience.
tabs.content1: To highlight my multilingual skills, I implemented a translation feature on my website. This allows users to switch between different languages, enhancing their browsing experience and facilitating effective communication.
tabs.content2: To ensure a concise yet informative presentation of my projects, I utilized accordions and tabs. This allowed me to include ample details without overwhelming the user with excessive content length, resulting in a more organized and user-friendly browsing experience.

accordions.title: Development Highlights
accordions.intro: I want to highlight two key aspects of my development process: the i18n library and the implementation of a Dark/Light theme. These features enhance user experience and accessibility. Let's delve into them:

tabs.subtitle: i18n Library
tabs.heading: internationalization File
tabs.content: I imported the necessary modules for internationalization (i18n) and created this file.
tabs.content1: It loads translation data from JSON files for different sections of the application, merges them into language-specific objects, and initializes the i18n library with the loaded resources.
tabs.content2: The translations can then be accessed using the t object in other files, providing multilingual support for the application.
tabs.content3: The JSON files contain language-specific objects with key-value pairs representing different translations. Each language object (en, fr, es) includes translations for various phrases used in the application.

tabs.subtitle: Dark/Light theme
tabs.heading: UseContext Hook
tabs.content2: Using the useContext hook, I implemented a dark/light theme feature in my application. By adding the class 'light' or 'dark' to the top-level component, I dynamically changed the theme based on user preference. The ThemeToggleButton component allows users to toggle between the themes, and the ThemeContext provides access to the current theme status throughout the application.

accordions.title: Retrospective
accordions.question: What did I learn?
accordions.content: During this project, I deepened my knowledge of React and explored various hooks that I hadn't used before. Implementing the i18n library was a long-awaited achievement for me.
accordions.content1: I discovered that while libraries can save time, it's crucial to invest time in understanding their usage. Sometimes, learning to use a library effectively can be as time-consuming as building the functionality ourselves.
accordions.content2: Several areas could be improved. I rushed into development without properly planning the structure of the JSON file. I should have kept the translations for each language separate instead of combining them into a single file. This approach worked well for most files but made the projects.json file excessively long and difficult to maintain. Refactoring that structure is a priority.
accordions.content3: I need to rectify how I accessed translations in some files. Instead of using the t object, I mistakenly used the i18n object, which unnecessarily complicated things.
accordions.content5: I plan to improve the Accordion file by implementing consistent naming conventions, adding descriptive comments, and organizing the code into smaller, modular functions or components. These changes will enhance code readability, maintainability, and reusability.
accordions.content4: In the future, I plan to add supplementary search functionality that allows users to search projects based on skills. Additionally, integrating Google Analytics is on my roadmap.

projects.title: Ai Summit
projects.excerpt: A WooCommerce website as a team of 4. The purpose of the site is to sell tickets for a conference focused on Artificial Intelligence.

post.overview1: Ai-Summit is a WordPress and Woocomerce website integrating various plugins to enable users to purchase tickets seamlessly and sign up for our newsletter.
post.overview2: Throughout the development process, we efficiently managed tasks using Asana for project management.

accordions.title: Project Requirements
accordions.content: The AI Summit website showcases ticket sales for the conference, offering options for both normal and 'VIP' tickets, with lunch included for the latter.
accordions.content1: During ticket purchase, attendees provide their first name, last name, email address, and optionally their company name. The conference spans two days, featuring an opening keynote speaker and multiple sessions/workshops with showcased speakers on the schedule.
accordions.content2: Sponsors, grouped into four tiers, are displayed with logos and descriptions. The site also includes general info about the conference, a news feed for updates, and the ability to subscribe for email notifications.

accordions.title: Development Highlights
accordions.intro: We had the opportunity to build a website using WordPress and a variety of essential plugins. However, it wasn't just about improving our PHP and WordPress skills; it was also a valuable learning experience in Project Management. Throughout the development process, we honed our ability to adhere to timelines, set priorities, and successfully meet project goals and deliverables.
accordions.content: Apart from the technical aspects, we went the extra mile to ensure that the website was optimized for search engines, providing a strong foundation for Search Engine Optimization. By implementing SEO best practices, we aimed to improve the website's visibility and search engine rankings, ultimately driving more organic traffic to the site.

tabs.subtitle: Eventin Plugin
tabs.content: We used the Eventin plugin in the WordPress admin dashboard to create conference passes, schedules, and manage a list of attending speakers. Additionally, the plugin provided a convenient registration form for attendees.
tabs.content1: While the Eventin plugin simplified our event management, there were minor design limitations and potential compatibility issues to address. However, its benefits outweighed the drawbacks, and we successfully delivered a remarkable conference experience.

tabs.subtitle: Asana software
tabs.content: To effectively manage our tasks and ensure a smooth workflow, we relied on the powerful Asana software. Asana provided us with a comprehensive and user-friendly platform, allowing us to organize our work efficiently and keep track of pending tasks. Its intuitive interface and feature-rich environment made it a standout tool for our project needs.
tabs.content2: We found Asana to be an indispensable companion throughout the project, enhancing our productivity and contributing to the successful completion of our tasks.

accordions.title: Retrospective
accordions.question: What did I learn?
accordions.content: During this project, I gained valuable insights into the importance of effectively delivering a product to a client. I learned the significance of using non-technical language when communicating with clients, ensuring that they can easily understand the project's progress and outcomes. Additionally, this experience taught me the significance of thinking beyond the developer's perspective. Considering aspects such as the client's needs, business goals, and user experience was vital in creating a successful product.
accordions.content2: In retrospect, while Asana proved to be a great tool for task management, we didn't fully leverage its potential. We relied heavily on Slack for communication, resulting in some time wasted due to scattered discussions. In the future, we could improve our efficiency by maximizing the use of Asana, centralizing communication, and keeping all project-related discussions and updates in one place. This would undoubtedly enhance collaboration and streamline our workflow, leading to even better project outcomes.

projects.title: Lord of the Rings
projects.alt: Matching Game Lord of the Rings Screenshot
projects.excerpt: A matching game with added sound effects, implemented in JavaScript and CSS.

post.overview1: A memory matching game implemented in JavaScript, which consists of a grid of cards that the player needs to flip and match in pairs, keeping track of their matches, guesses, and remaining lives.

accordions.title: Project Requirements
accordions.content: The game required creating a single-player experience where the user had to match pairs of hidden pictures on a grid.
accordions.content1: The player can reveal up to two pictures in a turn, and if the pictures match, they remain revealed. If the pictures do not match, they return to being hidden after a certain time.
accordions.content2: The game should keep track of the player's turns, matches, and provide a start button and the option to end the game at any time.

accordions.title: Development Highlights
accordions.intro: I gained experience in utilizing various HTML elements and classes, manipulating the DOM, implementing event listeners, and managing game state variables.

tabs.subtitle: DOM Manipulation
tabs.content: Throughout the game development, I worked extensively with HTML elements, such as divs, buttons, headings, and images, to structure and present the user interface.

tabs.subtitle: Game State Management
tabs.content: To enable user interaction, I implemented event listeners that responded to actions like clicks or key presses. By attaching these event listeners to specific HTML elements, I could trigger appropriate actions and functions based on user input.
tabs.content1: Additionally, I managed the game's state variables, including lockCards, flippedCards, matches, guesses, and livesLeft. These variables played a crucial role in tracking the game's progress, implementing rules and mechanics, controlling the flow of the game, and updating the display accordingly.
tabs.content2: This comprehensive approach to event handling and game state management resulted in an engaging and interactive game experience for the players.

accordions.title: Retrospective
accordions.question: What did I learn?
accordions.content: In addition to managing game state variables and manipulating the DOM, I also acquired fundamental CSS skills, including flexbox and CSS grid. Furthermore, I gained knowledge and proficiency in implementing sound effects within the game.
accordions.content2: I want to improve my code by changing the way I approach it. Currently, I rely mostly on functions, but I plan to switch to using objects more extensively. By using objects as the main components of my code, I can make it better organized, structured, and easier to reuse in different parts of the game. This change will bring several benefits and help me create a more efficient and maintainable codebase.
accordions.content1: I would love to enhance the User Interface (UI) and create a more captivating experience.

post.overview1: This app is a React-based calculator that allows users to perform arithmetic calculations and store values in memory.

accordions.title: Project Requirements
accordions.content: Create a calculator with basic arithmetic operations, memory functionality, support for decimal numbers, and the ability to change the sign of a number.

accordions.title: Development Highlights
accordions.intro: During the development of this project, I focused on implementing a modular component structure and familiarizing myself with React hooks.

tabs.subtitle: Modular Structure
tabs.content: The code is organized into separate components (e.g., Header, Keypad, Display) to promote reusability and maintainability. This modular approach improves code organization and makes it easier to understand and manage.

tabs.subtitle: React Hooks
tabs.content: I utilized the useState hook to manage and update state variables in functional components. This allowed me to track and modify values like currentValue, previousValue, and memoryValue in an intuitive and efficient manner.

accordions.title: Retrospective
accordions.question: What did I learn?
accordions.content: During the development of the calculator app, I gained hands-on experience in working with React components, managing state using hooks, and implementing calculator functionalities such as handling operator clicks, performing calculations, and managing memory. This project helped me deepen my understanding of React and enhance my skills in building interactive user interfaces.
accordions.content2: Reflecting back, there are several areas in the calculator app that could benefit from improvement.
accordions.content3: Firstly, the code could be simplified and made less redundant through refactoring. Breaking down the logic into smaller functions and components would enhance manageability and ease of maintenance.
accordions.content4: Moreover, adding more comments and documentation to clarify the code's purpose and functionality would enhance its understandability for others and future reference.
accordions.content5: Lastly, exploring and implementing unit tests would ensure the reliability and robustness of the calculator app's functionalities.

projects.title: Vulcan
projects.excerpt: In a group of three, we developed a mockup website using HTML, SCSS, and JS.

post.overview1: Vulcan is a website created collaboratively by a team of three, using HTML, SCSS, and JS, with the purpose of replicating a mockup design. It serves as a demonstration of our abilities in developing functional and visually appealing web applications.

accordions.title: Project Requirements
accordions.content: The primary objective of the project is to create a website called Vulcan that closely resembles the provided mockup design.
accordions.content1: TThe website should demonstrate our proficiency in utilizing HTML5, SCSS, and JS to develop both functional and visually appealing web applications.
accordions.content2: Additionally, the project emphasizes teamwork and collaboration, requiring all team members to contribute collectively towards its successful completion.

tabs.subtitle: BEM Notation in SASS
tabs.content: I was responsible for developing the bottom half of the page and later took over the navigation section to assist a classmate. During the development process, I implemented the BEM (Block-Element-Modifier) notation in SASS wherever possible. BEM is a naming convention that promotes modular and reusable code structure. It helps in organizing CSS classes by breaking them down into independent blocks, elements, and modifiers, making it easier to manage and maintain the codebase.

CTALink1.text: BEM Notation in SCSS Github Link

tabs.subtitle: Responsiveness
tabs.content: We implemented responsiveness using SASS mixins and media queries. This allowed us to adapt the layout and styles based on different screen sizes, ensuring optimal display across devices.

accordions.title: Retrospective
accordions.question: What did I learn?
accordions.content: I learned the importance of teamwork and collaboration in a project. Working with a team allowed me to gain insights into different perspectives and leverage each team member's strengths. I also enhanced my skills in HTML, SCSS, and JS, especially in implementing the BEM notation and creating responsive designs using mixins and media queries.

projects.title: Brainy
projects.excerpt: A game that showcases front-end development questions to challenge GPT. This game was developed during the Hack the Break 2023 event with my classmate Connor from the FWD program at BCIT.

post.overview1: This project is a game that quizzes players on HTML, CSS, and JavaScript knowledge while they battle an enemy, utilizing object-oriented programming concepts.

accordions.title: Project Requirements
accordions.content: The project had a two-day deadline, starting on Saturday and finishing on Sunday, and required submitting a 3-minute video pitch on YouTube, publicly accessible, by the next day. The video pitch needed to include a project description, the problem it aims to solve, and a demonstration of the project. The theme of the project is job security, and we had the freedom to explore our own ideas and approaches.

accordions.title: Development Highlights
accordions.intro: During the hackathon, our team had limited programming knowledge, but we made the most of it. We faced challenges while learning about GitHub, which caused some delays. Additionally, we were not familiar with component-based structures like SASS or React components, which would have made teamwork easier.

tabs.subtitle: GitHub
tabs.content: We encountered some challenges while dealing with conflicts in the GitHub interface and faced issues. Due to the time constraint with the deadline, we made the decision to abandon a branch and create a new one as we were unsure of a better approach.

tabs.subtitle: @keyframes animations
tabs.content: To create animations for the 'monster' and 'player' images, we utilized keyframes in our project. We incorporated sprites from the website craftpix.net.

accordions.title: Retrospective
accordions.question: What did I learn?
accordions.content: My first online hackathon taught me the importance of participating and taking on challenges, even with limited knowledge. If we were to do the same hackathon again, we would aim for a more advanced project. I also discovered that effective teamwork requires collaborating on different files, which was a challenge in this project.
accordions.content2: The game needs to be completed, and the user interface (UI) needs polishing. We abandoned the game as soon as the hackathon finished and returned to our busy BCIT schedule.
accordions.content3: Our next step should be to rebuild the site using modular programming languages such as React or another framework, along with SCSS or Tailwind CSS. This would allow us to work more efficiently and faster.
accordions.content4: Originally, we wanted to fetch the Chat GPT API to retrieve the questions dynamically instead of hard-coding them in our JS file. We didn't know how to do that during the hackathon, but now we have the knowledge to refactor it.

projects.title: Pizzeria l'Arena
projects.excerpt: This is a pizzeria website built using a headless CMS approach. The front-end is developed using Vue.js and Tailwind CSS, while Wordpress serves as the backend.

post.overview1: This is a pizzeria website built using a headless CMS approach for a business in Spain. The front-end is developed using Vue.js and Tailwind CSS, while Wordpress serves as the backend.

accordions.title: Project Requirements
accordions.content: The website must have the following sections: a promotion section, a pizzas section with different prices for take-out or eat-in, a crepes section and a desserts section.

tabs.subtitle: Vue.js
tabs.content: Exploring Vue.js for the first time was an exciting step in my development journey. Despite my familiarity with React, I discovered that Vue brings its own unique perspective to web development. This pizzeria website provided me with the opportunity to delve into Vue's library and create a functional site. While I made significant progress, I recognize that there's still much more to learn and master in Vue's ecosystem.

tabs.subtitle: Tailwind CSS
tabs.content: Taking my familiarity with Tailwind CSS to the next level, I decided to apply it to this pizzeria website. While I had dabbled with Tailwind in the past, this project marked my first comprehensive experience with it. The beauty of Tailwind lies in its utility classes, which allowed me to streamline styling without the need to craft extensive custom class names. As a result, I spent less time dealing with intricate CSS and more time focusing on functionality and design. Tailwind's efficiency truly resonated with me, making it a valuable addition to my skill set.

accordions.title: Retrospective
accordions.question: What did I learn?
accordions.content: I'm currently in the process of adding the Wordpress backend, enabling pizzeria owners to manage content and prices themselves. This project has shown me the value of a CMS in simplifying content management and collaboration.
accordions.content2: I've experienced Tailwind CSS's efficiency, using utility classes to streamline styling and allocate more time to functionality and design.
accordions.content3: Through building this pizzeria website, I've gained insights into Vue.js's unique capabilities for dynamic interfaces and look forward to exploring them further.
accordions.content5: I'm exploring ways to incorporate multilingual support into the CMS for a more inclusive user experience.
accordions.content6: I'm focused on improving the site's SEO to ensure better visibility and reach on search engines.
accordions.content7: I'm also evaluating the possibility of refactoring the site using Next.js to optimize its performance and user experience.

projects.title: Quillerina Paper Art (WIP)
projects.excerpt: This is a woocommerce website still on construction that showcases the work of an artist in British Columbia

post.overview1: This is a woocommerce website still on construction that showcases the work of an artist in British Columbia

accordions.title: Project Requirements
accordions.content: This woocommerce needs to showcase 3 types of products (custom pet portraits, earrings and other artworks). It also needs to accept Credit Card payments.

accordions.title: Development Highlights
accordions.intro: This project served as a valuable opportunity for me to delve into WordPress and the Woocommerce ecosystem. Initially, I faced a learning curve in understanding these platforms, but as I progressed, I gained a better grasp of their functionalities.

tabs.subtitle: ACF and CPT
tabs.content: By building my own website, I've learned when to use ACF fields or Custom Post Types. I found that using ACF fields for most things made a big difference. Their flexibility and capabilities have truly amazed me, helping me unlock their full potential.

tabs.subtitle: Custom Template vs WordPress Hierarchy
tabs.content: I've figured out the difference between custom templates and the WordPress hierarchy. Custom templates let me create special designs for different parts of my website. On the other hand, the WordPress hierarchy helps the website pick the right template for each page. This new knowledge makes building websites with WordPress much easier for me.

accordions.title: Retrospective
accordions.question: What did I learn?
accordions.content: Reflecting on my journey, I've acquired an in-depth understanding of the structure within WordPress and WooCoomerce.
accordions.content2: Additionally, I've learned the intricate process of transferring a WordPress site from a localhost environment to a live server, enhancing my practical skills in web development.
accordions.content5: As I near the completion of building the site, I'm currently tackling a few remaining bugs that need fixing. With the finishing touches in sight, I'll be thoroughly reviewing the entire project to ensure its functionality and aesthetics align with my vision.

post.overview1: A simple JavaScript exercise made a few years back from JavaScript30.com website where users can play music by pressing any keybaord key
